intro: Collomia cavanillesii f. lateritia, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. This subspecies is notable for its adaptability to harsh, high-altitude conditions.
